gurmukhi: ੧ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਮਹਿਮਾ
transliteration: Vaar 15
translation: Vaar 15

gurmukhi: ੴ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਪ੍ਰਸਾਦਿ ॥
transliteration: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?
translation: One Oankar, the primal energy realised through the grace of divine preceptor

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਸਚਾ ਪਾਤਿਸਾਹੁ ਕੂੜੇ ਬਾਦਿਸਾਹ ਦੁਨੀਅਾਵੇ
transliteration: Satiguru Sachaa Paatisaahu Koorhay Baadisaah Douneeaavay.
translation: The true Guru (God) is the true emperor; all other worldly kinds are fake ones.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਨਾਥਾ ਨਾਥੁ ਹੈ ਹੋੲਿ ਨੳੁਂ ਨਾਥ ਅਨਾਥ ਨਿਥਾਵੇ
transliteration: Satiguru Naadaa Naadu Hai Hoi Naoun Naad Anaad Nidaavay.
translation: The true Guru is the Lord of lords; the nine naths (members and heads of ascetic yogi orders) are refugeless and without any master.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਸਚੁ ਦਾਤਾਰ ਹੈ ਹੋਰੁ ਦਾਤੇ ਫਿਰਦੇ ਪਾਛਾਵੇ
transliteration: Satiguru Sachu Daataaru Hai Horu Daatay Dhiraday Paachhaavay.
translation: The true Guru is the true bestower; other donors just move after Him.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਕਰਤਾ ਪੁਰਖੁ ਹੈ ਕਰਿ ਕਰਤੂਤਿ ਨਿਨਾਵਨਿ ਨਾਵੇ
transliteration: Satiguru Karataa Purakhu Hai Kari Karatooti Ninaavani Naavay.
translation: The true Guru is the creator and makes the unknown famous by giving them the name (naam).

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਸਚਾ ਸਾਹੁ ਹੈ ਹੋਰੁ ਸਾਹ ਵੇਸਾਹ ੳੁਚਾਵੇ
transliteration: Satiguru Sachaa Saahu Hai Horu Saah Avaysaah Ouchaavay.
translation: True Guru is the real banker; other rich person’s cannot be believed.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਸਚਾ ਵੈਦੁ ਹੈ ਹੋਰੁ ਵੈਦੁ ਸਭ ਕੈਦ ਕੂੜਾਵੇ
transliteration: Satiguru Sachaa Vaidu Hai Horu Vaidu Sabh Kaid Koorhaavay.
translation: The true Guru is the true physician; others themselves are imprisoned in the false bondage of transmigration.

gurmukhi: ਵਿਣੁ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਸਭਿ ਨਿਗੋਸਾਵੈ ॥੧॥
transliteration: Vinu Satiguru Sabhi Nigosaavai ?1?
translation: Without the true Guru they all are without the guiding force.

gurmukhi: ੨ ਓਹੋ ਹੀ
translation: Praise of the true Guru

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਤੀਰਥੁ ਜਾਣੀਅੈ ਅਠਸਠਿ ਤੀਰਥ ਸਰਣੀ ਅਾੲੇ
transliteration: Satiguru Teeradu Jaaneeai Atdasatdi Teerad Saranee Aaay.
translation: The true Guru is that pilgrimages centre in whose shelter are the sixty-eight pilgrimage centres of the Hindus.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਦੇੳੁ ਅਭੇੳੁ ਹੈ ਹੋਰੁ ਦੇਵ ਗੁਰੁ ਸੇਵ ਤਰਾੲੇ
transliteration: Satiguru Dayu Abhayu Hai Horu Dayv Guru Sayv Taraaay.
translation: Being beyond dualities, the true a Guru is the supreme God and other gods get across the world ocean only by serving Him.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਪਾਰਸਿ ਪਰਸਿਅੈ ਲਖ ਪਾਰਸ ਪਾਖਾਕੁ ਸੁਹਾੲੇ
transliteration: Satiguru Paarasi Parasiai Lakh Paaras Paa Khaaku Suhaaay.
translation: The true Guru is that philosopher's stone the dust of whose feet adorns millions of philosopher's stones.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਪੂਰਾ ਪਾਰਿਜਾਤੁ ਪਾਰਜਾਤ ਲਖ ਸਫਲਿ ਧਿਅਾੲੇ
transliteration: Satiguru Pooraa Paarijaatu Paarajaat Lakh Saphal Dhiaaay.
translation: The true Guru is that perfect wish-fulfilling tree who is meditated upon by the millions of wish-fulfilling trees.

gurmukhi: ਸੁਖ ਸਾਗਰੁ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਪੁਰਖੁ ਰਤਨ ਪਦਾਰਥ ਸਿਖ ਸੁਣਾੲੇ
transliteration: Soukh Saagar Satigur Purakhu Ratan Padaarad Sikh Sounaaay.
translation: The true Guru being ocean of delights distributes pearls in the form of different sermons.

gurmukhi: ਚਿੰਤਾਮਣਿ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਚਰਣ ਚਿੰਤਾਮਣੀ ਅਚਿੰਤ ਕਰਾੲੇ
transliteration: Chintaamani Satigur Charan Chintaamanee Achint Karaaay.
translation: The feet of the true Guru are that desire fulfilling fabulous gem (chintamani) which makes myriads of gems free of anxieties.

gurmukhi: ਵਿਣੁ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਸਭਿ ਦੂਜੇ ਭਾੲੇ ॥੨॥
transliteration: Vinu Satigur Sabhi Doojai Bhaaay ?2?
translation: Except the true Guru (God) all other is duality (which makes one go the cycle of transmigration).

gurmukhi: ੩ ਮਾਨਸ ਦੇਹ ਦੀ ੳੁਤਪਤੀ
translation: Origin of the Human body

gurmukhi: ਲਖ ਚੳੁਰਾਸੀਹ ਜੂਨਿ ਵਿਚਿ ੳੁਤਮੁ ਜੂਨਿ ਸੁ ਮਾਣਸ ਦੇਹੀ
transliteration: Lakh Chauraaseeh Jooni Vichi Outamu Jooni Su Maanas Dayhee.
translation: Out of the eighty-four lakh species, the human life is the best one.

gurmukhi: ਅਖੀ ਦੇਖੈ ਨਦਰਿ ਕਰਿ ਜਿਹਬਾ ਬੋਲੈ ਬਚਨ ਬਿਦੇਹੀ
transliteration: Akhee Daykhai Nadari Kari Jihabaa Bolay Bachan Bidayhee.
translation: By his eyes man beholds and with his tongue he eulogises God.

gurmukhi: ਕੰਨੀ ਸੁਣਦਾ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਕਰਿ ਵਾਸ ਲੲੇ ਨਕਿ ਸਾਸ ਸਨੇਹੀ
transliteration: Kannee Sounadaa Surati Kari Vaas Laay Naki Saas Sanayhee.
translation: By ears he listens carefully and smells lovingly by his nose.

gurmukhi: ਹਥੀ ਕਿਰਤਿ ਕਮਾਵਣੀ ਪੈਰੀ ਚਲਣੁ ਜੋਤਿ ੲਿਵੇਹੀ
transliteration: Hadee Kirati Kamaavanee Pairee Chalanu Joti Ivayhee.
translation: By hands he earns livelihood and moves by the power of feet.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਜਨਮੁ ਸਕਾਰਥਾ ਮਨਮੁਖ ਮੂਰਤਿ ਮਤਿ ਕਿਨੇਹੀ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Janamu Sakaaradaa Manamoukh Moorati Mati Kinayhee.
translation: In this species, the life of a gurmukh is successful but how is the thinking of manmukh, the mind-orientated one ? The thinking of the manmukh is evil.

gurmukhi: ਕਰਤਾ ਪੁਰਖੁ ਵਿਸਾਰਿਕੈ ਮਾਣਸ ਦੀ ਮਨਿ ਅਾਸ ਧਰੇਹੀ
transliteration: Karataa Purakhu Visaari Kai Maanas Dee Mani Aas Dharayhee.
translation: Manmukh, forgetting the Lord goes on pinning his hopes upon men.

gurmukhi: ਪਸੂ ਪਰੇਤਹੁ ਬੁਰੀ ਬੁਰੇਹੀ ॥੩॥
transliteration: Pasoo Paraytahu Buree Hurayhee ?3?
translation: His body is worse than then animals’ and the ghosts’.

gurmukhi: ੪ ਬੰਦੇ ਦਾ ਬੰਦਾ, ਮਨਮੁਖ ਦੀ ਦਸ਼ਾ
translation: Slave of the man;the position of the manmukh  ,

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਸਾਹਿਬੁ ਛਡਿ ਕੈ ਮਨਮੁਖ ਹੋੲਿ ਬੰਦੇ ਦਾ ਬੰਦਾ
transliteration: Satigur Saahibu Chhadi Kai Manamoukhu Hoi Banday Daa Bandaa.
translation: Manmukh, the mind-orientated, leaving away the true Guru Lord becomes slave of man.

gurmukhi: ਹੁਕਮੀ ਬੰਦਾ ਹੋੲਿ ਕੈ ਨਿਤ ੳੁਠਿ ਜਾੲਿ ਸਲਾਮੁ ਕਰੰਦਾ
transliteration: Houkamee Bandaa Hoi Kai Nit Outdi Jaai Salaam Karandaa.
translation: Becoming errand boy of man he goes daily to salute him.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਠ ਪਹਰ ਹਥ ਜੋੜਿ ਕੈ ਹੋੲਿ ਹਜੂਰੀ ਖੜਾ ਰਹੰਦਾ
transliteration: Aatd Pahar Had Jorhi Kai Hoi Hajooree Kharhaa Rahandaa.
translation: All the twenty four hours (eight pahars) with folded hands he stands before his master.

gurmukhi: ਨੀਦ ਨ ਭੁਖ ਨ ਸੁਖ ਤਿਸੁ ਸੂਲੀ ਚੜ੍ਹਿਅਾ ਰਹੈ ਡਰੰਦਾ
transliteration: Need N Bhoukh N Soukh Tisu Soolee Charhhiaa Rahai Darandaa.
translation: Sleep, hunger and pleasure he does not have and remains so scared as if he has been sacrificed.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਣੀ ਪਾਲਾ ਧੁਪ ਛਾੳੁ ਸਿਰ ੳੁਤੈ ਝਲਿ ਦੁਖ ਸਹੰਦਾ
transliteration: Paanee Paalaa Dhoup Chhaau Sir Outai Jhali Doukh Sahandaa.
translation: Throughout rains, cold, sunlight, shade, he undergoes myriad sufferings.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਤਸ ਬਾਜੀ ਸਾਰੁ ਵੇਖਿ ਰਣ ਵਿਚਿ ਘਾੲਿਲੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਮਰੰਦਾ
transliteration: Aatasabaajee Saaru Vaykhi Ran Vichi Ghaailu Hoi Marandaa.
translation: In the battlefield (of life) this same person, considering sparks of iron as fireworks gets mortally wounded.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਪੂਰੇ ਵਿਣੁ ਜੂਨਿ ਭਵੰਦਾ ॥੪॥
transliteration: Gur Pooray Vinu Jooni Bhavandaa ?4?
translation: Without the (shelter of) perfect Guru, he wanders through the species.

gurmukhi: ੫ ਕੰਨ-ਪਾਟਿਅਾਂ ਦਾ ਹਾਲ
translation: Condition of the split-ears-

gurmukhi: ਨਾਥਾਂ ਨਾਥੁ ਨ ਸੇਵਨੀ ਹੋੲਿ ਅਨਾਥ ਗੁਰੂ ਬਹੁ ਚੇਲੇ
transliteration: Naadaan Naadu N Sayvanee Hoi Anaadu Guroo Bahu Chaylay.
translation: Not serving the Lord (God) of Lords, many lords (naths) becoming gurus initiate people as their disciples.

gurmukhi: ਕੰਨ ਪੜਾੲਿ ਬਿਭੂਤਿ ਲਾੲਿ ਖਿੰਥਾ ਖਪਰੁ ਡੰਡਾ ਹੇਲੇ
transliteration: Kann Parhaai Bibhooti Laai Khindaa Khaparu Dandaa Haylay.
translation: They getting the ears split and applying ashes on their bodies carry begging bowls and staff.

gurmukhi: ਘਰਿ ਘਰਿ ਟੁਕਰ ਮੰਗਦੇ ਸਿੰਙੀ ਨਾਦੁ ਵਾਜਾੲਿਨਿ ਭੇਲੇ
transliteration: Ghari Ghari Toukar Mangaday Sinee Naadu Vaajaaini Bhaylay.
translation: Going from door to door, they beg food and blow their singi, a special instrument made of horn.

gurmukhi: ਭੁਗਤਿ ਪਿਅਾਲਾ ਵੰਡੀਅੈ ਸਿਧਿ ਸਾਧਿਕ ਸਿਵਰਾਤੀ ਮੇਲੇ
transliteration: Bhougati Piaalaa Vandeeai Sidhi Saadhik Sivaraatee Maylay.
translation: Getting together on the Sivaratri fair they share with one another the food and the cup of drinks.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਰਹ ਪੰਥ ਚਲਾੲਿਦੇ ਬਾਰਹ ਵਾਟੀ ਖਰੇ ਦੁਹੇਲੇ
transliteration: Baarah Pand Chalaaiday Baarah Vaatee Kharay Duhaylay.
translation: They follow one of the twelve sects (of yogis) and go on moving on these twelve ways i.e. they go on transmigrating.

gurmukhi: ਵਿਣੁ ਗੁਰ ਸਬਦ ਨ ਸਿਝਨੀ ਬਾਜੀਗਰ ਕਰਿ ਬਾਜੀ ਖੇਲੇ
transliteration: Vinu Gur Sabad N Sijhanee Baajeegar Kari Baajee Khaylay.
translation: Without the word of the Guru, none gets liberated and all of them run here and there like acrobats.

gurmukhi: ਅੰਨ੍ਹੈ ਅੰਨ੍ਹਾ ਖੂਹੀ ਠੇਲੇ ॥੫॥
transliteration: Annhai Annhaa Khoohee Tdaylay ?5?
translation: This way the blind one goes on pushing the blind into the well.

gurmukhi: ੬ ਪੂਰੇ ਗੁਰੂ ਬਾਝ ਰੋਣਾ
translation: Weeping and wailing without the perfect Guru

gurmukhi: ਸਚੁ ਦਾਤਾਰੁ ਵਿਸਾਰਕੈ ਮੰਗਤਿਅਾਂ ਨੋ ਮੰਗਣ ਜਾਹੀ
transliteration: Sachu Daataaru Visaar Kai Mangatiaan No Mangan Jaahee.
translation: Forgetting the true bestower, people spread their hands before the beggars.

gurmukhi: ਢਾਢੀ ਵਾਰਾਂ ਗਾਵਦੇ ਵੈਰ ਵਿਰੋਧ ਜੋਧ ਸਾਲਾਹੀ
transliteration: Ddhaaddhee Vaaraan Gaanvaday Vair Virodh Jodh Saalaahee.
translation: The bards sing of the brave works pertaining to the brave and eulogise the duels and enmities of the warriors.

gurmukhi: ਨਾੲੀ ਗਾਵਨਿ ਸੱਦੜੇ ਕਰਿ ਕਰਤੂਤਿ ਮੁੲੇ ਬਦਰਾਹੀ
transliteration: Naaee Gaavani Sadarhay Kari Karatooti Mooay Badaraahee.
translation: The barbers also sing the praises of those who have died treading evil path and committing evil deeds.

gurmukhi: ਪੜਦੇ ਭਟ ਕਵਿਤ ਕਰਿ ਕੂੜ ਕੁਸਤੁ ਮੁਖਹੁ ਅਲਾਹੀ
transliteration: Parhaday Bhat Kavit Kari Koorh Kousatu Moukhahi Aalaahee.
translation: The eulogisers recite poetry for false kings and go on telling lies.

gurmukhi: ਹੋੲਿ ਅਸ ਰੀਤਿ ਪੁਰੋਹਤਾ ਪ੍ਰੀਤਿ ਪਰੀਤੈ ਵਿਰਤਿ ਮੰਗਾਹੀ
transliteration: Hoi Asirit Purohitaa Preeti Pareetai Virati Mangaahee.
translation: The priests first seek shelter but afterwards lay their claim of bread and butter i.e. they entangle people in the fear of the net of ritualism.

gurmukhi: ਛੁਰੀਅਾ ਮਾਰਨਿ ਪੰਖੀੲੇ ਹਟਿ ਹਟਿ ਮੰਗਦੇ ਭਿਖ ਭਵਾਹੀ
transliteration: Chhureeaa Maarani Pankheeay Hati Hati Mangaday Bhikh Bhavaahee.
translation: The people belonging to the sects of persons wearing feathers on their heads punch their bodies with knives and go on begging from shop to shop.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਪੂਰੇ ਵਿਣੁ ਰੋਵਨਿ ਧਾਹੀ ॥੬॥
transliteration: Gur Pooray Vinu Rovani Dhaahee ?6?
translation: But without the perfect Guru, they all wail and weep bitterly.

gurmukhi: ੭ ਝੂਠੇ ਸਾਕ
translation: The fake relations

gurmukhi: ਕਰਤਾ ਪੁਰਖੁ ਨ ਚੇਤਿਓ ਕੀਤੇ ਨੋ ਕਰਤਾ ਕਰਿ ਜਾਣੈ
transliteration: Karataa Purakhu N Chaytiao Keetay No Karataa Kari Jaanai.
translation: O man, you have not remembered the creator and have accepted the created as your creator.

gurmukhi: ਨਾਰਿ ਭਤਾਰਿ ਪਿਅਾਰੁ ਕਰਿ ਪੁਤੁ ਪੋਤਾ ਪਿੳੁ ਦਾਦੁ ਵਖਾਣੈ
transliteration: Naari Bhataari Piaaru Kari Poutu Potaa Piu Daadu Vakhaanai.
translation: Getting engrossed in wife or husband you have further created relationships of son, grandson, father and grandfather.

gurmukhi: ਧੀਅਾ ਭੈਣਾ ਮਾਣੁ ਕਰਿ ਤੁਸਨਿ ਰੁਸਨਿ ਸਾਕ ਬਬਾਣੈ
transliteration: Dheeaa Bhainaa Maanu Kari Tousani Rousani Saak Babaanai.
translation: Daughters and sisters proudly become happy or annoyed and such is the case of all relatives.

gurmukhi: ਸੀਹੁਰੁ ਪੀਹੁਰੁ ਨਾਨਕੇ ਪਰਵਾਰੈ ਸਾਧਾਰੁ ਧਿਙਾਣੈ
transliteration: Saahur Peeharu Naanakay Paravaarai Saadhaaru Dhiaanai.
translation: All other relation's such as the house of father-in-law, one's mother's house, the house of the maternal uncles and other relations of the family are disdainful.

gurmukhi: ਚਜ ਅਚਾਰ ਵੀਚਾਰ ਵਿਚਿ ਪੰਚਾ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਪਤਿ ਪਰਵਾਣੈ
transliteration: Chaj Achaar Veechaar Vichi Panchaa Andari Pati Paravaanai.
translation: If conduct and thoughts are civilised, one gets honour before the high ups of the society.

gurmukhi: ਅੰਤਕਾਲ ਜਮਜਾਲ ਵਿਚਿ ਸਾਥੀ ਕੋੲਿ ਨ ਹੋੲਿ ਸਿਞਞਞਞਾਣੈ
transliteration: Ant Kaal Jam Jaal Vichi Saadee Koi N Hoi Siaanai.
translation: However, at the end, when caught up in the web of death, no companion takes notice of the person.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਪੂਰੇ ਵਿਣੁ ਜਾੲਿ ਜਮਾਣੈ ॥੭॥
transliteration: Gur Pooray Vinu Jaai Jamaanai ?7?
translation: Bereft of the grace of the perfect Guru, all persons become scared of death.

gurmukhi: ੮ ਝੂਠੇ ਵਪਾਰੀ
translation: False merchants

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਸਾਹੁ ਅਥਾਹੁ ਛਡਿ ਕੂੜੇ ਸਾਹੁ ਕੂੜੇ ਵਣਜਾਰੇ
transliteration: Satiguru Saahu Adaahu Chhadi Koorhay Saahu Koorhay Vanajaaray.
translation: Except the infinite true Guru all other bankers and traders are false.

gurmukhi: ਸੳੁਦਾਗਰ ਸੳੁਦਾਗਰੀ ਘੋੜੇ ਵਣਜ ਕਰਨਿ ਅਤਿ ਭਾਰੇ
transliteration: Saudaagar Saudaagaree Ghorhay Vanaj Karani Ati Bhaaray.
translation: The merchants trade heavily in horses.

gurmukhi: ਰਤਨਾ ਪਰਖ ਜਵਾਹਰੀ ਹੀਰੇ ਮਾਣਕ ਵਣਜ ਪਸਾਰੇ
transliteration: Ratanaa Parakh Javaaharee Heeray Maanak Vanaj Pasaaray.
translation: The jewellers test the jewels and through diamonds and rubies spread their business.

gurmukhi: ਹੋੲਿ ਸਰਾਫ ਬਜਾਜ ਬਹੁ ਸੁੲਿਨਾ ਰੁਪਾ ਕਪੜੁ ਤਾਰੇ
transliteration: Hoi Saraadh Bajaaj Bahu Suinaa Roupaa Kaparhu Bhaaray.
translation: Gold merchants deal in gold and cash and drapers deal in clothes.

gurmukhi: ਕਿਰਸਾਣੀ ਕਿਰਸਾਣ ਕਰਿ ਬੀਜ ਲੁਣਨਿ ਬੋਹਲ ਵਿਸਥਾਰੇ
transliteration: Kirasaanee Kirasaan Kari Beej Lounani Bohal Visadaaray.
translation: Farmers undertake farming and sowing seed cut it afterwards and makes it big heaps.

gurmukhi: ਲਾਹਾ ਤੋਟਾ ਵਰੁ ਸਰਾਪੁ ਕਰਿ ਸੰਜੋਗੁ ਵਿਜੋਗੁ ਵਿਚਾਰੇ
transliteration: Laahaa Totaa Varu Saraapu Kari Sanjogu Vijogu Vichaaray.
translation: In all this business, profit, loss, boon, cure, meeting, separation goes hand in hand.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਪੂਰੇ ਵਿਣੁ ਦੁਖੁ ਸੈਂਸਾਰੇ ॥੮॥
transliteration: Gur Pooray Vinu Doukhu Sainsaaray ?8?
translation: Without the perfect Guru there is nothing in this world except suffering.

gurmukhi: ੯ ਝੂਠੇ ਵੈਦ ਦੀ ਵੈਦਗੀ
translation: Exceptthe perfect Guru all physicians are fake

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਵੈਦੁ ਨ ਸੇਵਿਓ ਰੋਗੀ ਵੈਦੁ ਨ ਰੋਗੁ ਮਿਟਾਵੈ
transliteration: Soutiguru Vaidu N Sayviao Rogee Vaidu N Rogu Mitaavai.
translation: The true physician in the form of true Guru (God) has never been served; then how could a physician who himself is diseased remove the malady of others?

gurmukhi: ਕਾਮ ਕ੍ਰੋਧੁ ਵਿਚਿ ਲੋਭੁ ਮੋਹੁ ਦੁਬਿਧਾ ਕਰਿ ਕਰਿ ਧ੍ਰੋਹੁ ਵਧਾਵੈ
transliteration: Kaam Krodhu Vichi Lobhu Mohu Doubidhaa Kari Kari Dhrohu Vadhaavai.
translation: These worldly physicians who themselves are engrossed in the lust, anger, greed, infatuation, deceive people and enhance their diseases.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਧਿ ਬਿਅਾਧਿ ੳੁਪਾਧਿ ਵਿਚਿ ਮਰਿ ਮਰਿ ਜੰਮੈ ਦੁਖਿ ਵਿਹਾਵੈ
transliteration: Aadhi Biaadhi Oupaadhi Vichi Mari Mari Janmai Doukhi Vihaavai.
translation: This way man involved in these ailments goes on transmigrating and remains full of suffering.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਵੈ ਜਾੲਿ ਭਵਾੲੀਅੈ ਭਵਜਲ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਪਾਰੁ ਨ ਪਾਵੈ
transliteration: Aavai Jaai Bhavaaeeai Bhavajal Andari Paaru N Paavai.
translation: He goes stray by coming and going and becomes unable to go across the world-ocean.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਸਾ ਮਨਸਾ ਮੋਹਣੀ ਤਾਮਸੁ ਤਿਸਨਾ ਸਾਂਤਿ ਨ ਅਾਵੈ
transliteration: Aasaa Manasaa Mohanee Taamasu Tisanaa Saanti N Aavai.
translation: Hopes and desires always attract his mind and being guided by evil propensities he never attains peace.

gurmukhi: ਬਲਦੀ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਤੇਲੁ ਪਾੲਿ ਕਿੳੁ ਮਨੁ ਮੂਰਖੁ ਅਗਿ ਬੁਝਾਵੈ
transliteration: Baladee Andari Taylu Paai Kiu Manu Moorakhu Agi Bujhaavai.
translation: How could a manmukh extinguish fire by putting oil on it?

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰੁ ਪੂਰੇ ਵਿਣੁ ਕੳੁਣੁ ਛੁਡਾਵੈ ॥੯॥
transliteration: Guru Pooray Vinu Kaounu Chhudaavai ?9?
translation: Who except the perfect Guru can liberate man from these bondage's?

gurmukhi: ੧੦ ਝੂਠੇ ਤੀਰਥ
translation: Fake pilgrimage centres

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਤੀਰਥੁ ਛਡਿ ਕੈ ਅਠਿਸਠਿ ਤੀਰਥ ਨਾਵਣ ਜਾਹੀ
transliteration: Satiguru Teeradu Chhadi Kai Atdisatdi Teerad Naavan Jaahee.
translation: Leaving aside pilgrimage centre in the form of the true Guru (God) people go to take bath at the sixty-eight holy places.

gurmukhi: ਬਗੁਲ ਸਮਾਧਿ ਲਗਾੲਿਕੈ ਜਿੳੁ ਜਲ ਜੰਤਾਂ ਘੁਟਿ ਘੁਟਿ ਖਾਹੀ
transliteration: Bagul Samaadhi Lagaai Kai Jiu Jal Jantaan Ghouti Ghouti Khaahee.
translation: Like crane, they keep their eyes closed in trance but they catch hold of small creatures, press them hard and eat them.

gurmukhi: ਹਸਤੀ ਨੀਰਿ ਨਵਾਲੀਅਨਿ ਬਾਹਰਿ ਨਿਕਲਿ ਖੇਹ ੳੁਡਾਹੀ
transliteration: Hasatee Neeri Navaaleeani Baahari Nikali Khayh Udaahee.
translation: Elephant is given bath in water, but coming out of water it again spreads dust on its body.

gurmukhi: ਨਦੀ ਨ ਡੁਬੈ ਤੂੰਬੜੀ ਤੀਰਥੁ ਵਿਸੁ ਨਿਵਾਰੈ ਨਾਹੀ
transliteration: Nadee N Doubai Toonbarhee Teeradu Visu Nivaarai Naahee.
translation: Colocynth does not drown in water and even baths at many pilgrimage centres do not let its poison go.

gurmukhi: ਪਥਰੁ ਨੀਰ ਪਖਾਲੀਅੈ ਚਿਤਿ ਕਠੋਰੁ ਨ ਭਿਜੈ ਕਾਹੀ
transliteration: Padaru Neer Pakhaaleeai Chiti Katdoru N Bhijai Gaahee.
translation: Stone put and washed in water remains hard as before and water does not get inside it.

gurmukhi: ਮਨਮੁਖ ਭਰਮ ਨ ੳੁਤਰੈ ਭੰਭਲਭੂਸੇ ਖਾੲਿ ਭਵਾਹੀ
transliteration: Manamoukh Bharam N Outarai Bhanbhalabhoosay Khaai Bhavaahee.
translation: The illusions and doubts of the mind orientated, manmukh, never come to an end and he always wanders in dubiety.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਪੂਰੇ ਵਿਣੁ ਪਾਰ ਨ ਪਾਹੀ ॥੧੦॥
transliteration: Guru Pooray Vinu Paar N Paahee ?10?
translation: Without the perfect Guru none can go across the world-ocean.

gurmukhi: ੧੧ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੂ ਪਾਰਸ
translation: True Guru is philosopher's stone

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਪਾਰਸੁ ਪਰਹਰੈ ਪਥਰੁ ਪਾਰਸੁ ਢੂੰਢਣ ਜਾੲੇ
transliteration: Satigur Paarasu Paraharai Padaru Paarasu Ddhoonddhan Jaaay.
translation: Leaving aside the philosophers stone in the form of the true Guru, people go on searching the material philosopher's stone.

gurmukhi: ਅਸਟ ਧਾਤੁ ੲਿਕ ਧਾਤੁ ਕਰਿ ਲੁਕਦਾ ਫਿਰੈ ਨ ਪ੍ਰਗਟੀ ਅਾੲੇ
transliteration: Asat Dhaatu Ik Dhaatu Kari Loukadaa Dhirai N Pragatee Aaay.
translation: The true Guru who can transform eight metals into gold in fact keeps himself hidden and does not get noticed.

gurmukhi: ਲੈ ਵਣਵਾਸੁ ੳੁਦਾਸੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਮਾੲਿਅਾਧਾਰੀ ਭਰਮਿ ਭੁਲਾੲੇ
transliteration: Lai Vanavaasu Udaasu Hoi Maaiaadhaaree Bharami Bhulaaay.
translation: Mammon-orientated person searches him in forests and gets disappointed in many illusions.

gurmukhi: ਹਥੀ ਕਾਲਖ ਛੁਥਿਅਾ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਕਾਲਖ ਲੋਭ ਲੁਭਾੲੇ
transliteration: Hadee Kaalakh Chhudiaa Andari Kaalakh Lobh Loubhaaay.
translation: The touch of riches blackens one's outside and the mind is also smeared by it.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਜ ਡੰਡੁ ਤਿਸੁ ਪਕੜਿਅਾ ਜਮਪੁਰਿ ਭੀ ਜਮਡੰਡੁ ਸਹਾੲੇ
transliteration: Raaj Dandu Tisu Pakarhiaa Jam Puri Bhee Jam Dandu Sahaaay.
translation: Catching hold of wealth makes one liable to public punishment here and to punishment by the lord of death there in his abode.

gurmukhi: ਮਨਮੁਖ ਜਨਮੁ ਅਕਾਰਥਾ ਦੂਜੈ ਭਾੲਿ ਕੁਦਾੲਿ ਹਰਾੲੇ
transliteration: Manamoukh Janamu Akaaradaa Doojai Bhaai Kudaai Haraaay.
translation: Futile is the birth of mind orientated; he getting engrossed in duality plays the wrong dice and loses the game of life.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਪੂਰੇ ਵਿਣੁ ਭਰਮੁ ਨ ਜਾੲੇ ॥੧੧॥
transliteration: Gur Pooray Vinu Bharamu N Jaaay ?11?
translation: Illusion cannot be removed without the perfect Guru.

gurmukhi: ੧੨ ਗੁਰ ਕਲਪ ਬ੍ਰਿੱਛ
translation: Guru, the wish fulfilling tree

gurmukhi: ਪਾਰਿਜਾਤ ਗੁਰੁ ਛਡਿ ਕੈ ਮੰਗਨਿ ਕਲਪਤਰੋਂ ਫਲ ਕਚੇ
transliteration: Paarijaatu Guru Chhadi Kai Mangani Kalap Taron Phal Kachay.
translation: Leaving the wish-fulfilling tree in the form of Guru, people desire to have the raw fruits of traditional wish-fulfilling tree (kalptaru/parijat).

gurmukhi: ਪਾਰਜਾਤ ਲਖ ਸੁਰਗ ਸਣੁ ਅਾਵਾਗਵਣੁ ਭਵਣ ਵਿਚਿ ਪਚੇ
transliteration: Paarajaatu Lakh Suragu Sanu Aavaa Gavanu Bhavan Vichi Pachay.
translation: Millions of parijat along with heavens are getting perished in the cycle of transmigration.

gurmukhi: ਮਰਦੇ ਕਰਿ ਕਰਿ ਕਾਮਨਾ ਦਿਤਿ ਭੁਗਤਿ ਵਿਚਿ ਰਚਿ ਵਿਰਚੇ
transliteration: Maraday Kari Kari Kaamanaa Diti Bhougati Vichi Rachi Virachay.
translation: Controlled by desires people are perishing and are busy in enjoying whatever has been bestowed by the Lord.

gurmukhi: ਤਾਰੇ ਹੋੲਿ ਅਗਾਸ ਚੜਿ ਓੜਕਿ ਤੁਟਿ ਤੁਟਿ ਥਾਨ ਹਲਚੇ
transliteration: Taaray Hoi Agaas Charhi Aorhaki Turhi Turhi Daan Halachay.
translation: Man of good actions establish in the sky in the form of stars and after exhausting the results of virtues again become falling stars.

gurmukhi: ਮਾਂ ਪਿੳੁ ਹੋੲੇ ਕੇਤੜੇ ਕੇਤੜਿਅਾਂ ਦੇ ਹੋੲੇ ਬਚੇ
transliteration: Maan Piu Hoay Kaytarhay Kaytarhiaan Day Hoay Bachay.
translation: Again through transmigration they become mothers and fathers and many beget children.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਪ ਪੁੰਨ ਬੀੳੁ ਬੀਜਦੇ ਦੁਖ ਸੁਖ ਫਲ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਚਹਮਚੇ
transliteration: Paap Pounnu Beeu Beejaday Doukh Soukh Phal Andari Chahamachay.
translation: Further sowing evils and virtues remain immersed in pleasures and sufferings.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਪੂਰੇ ਵਿਣੁ ਹਰਿ ਨ ਪਰਚੇ ॥੧੨॥
transliteration: Gur Pooray Vinu Hari N Parachay ?12?
translation: Without the perfect Guru, God cannot be made happy.
Without true Guru hard times are there

gurmukhi: ਸੁਖ ਸਾਗਰੁ ਗੁਰੁ ਛਡਿ ਕੈ ਭਵਜਲ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਭੰਭਲਭੂਸੇ
transliteration: Soukhu Saagaru Guroo Chhadi Kai Bhavajal Andari Bhanbhalabhoosay.
translation: Leaving the Guru, the Pleasure Ocean, one tosses up and down in the world-ocean of delusions and deceptions.

gurmukhi: ਲਹਰੀ ਨਾਲਿ ਪਛਾੜੀਅਨਿ ਹੳੁਮੈ ਅਗਨੀ ਅੰਦਰ ਲੂਸੇ
transliteration: Laharee Naali Pachhaarheeani Haoumai Aganee Andari Loosay.
translation: The stroke of the waves of the world-ocean tosses and the fire of ego continuously burns the inner self.

gurmukhi: ਜਮ ਦਰਿ ਬਧੇ ਮਾਰੀਅਨਿ ਜਮਦੂਤਾ ਦੇ ਧਕੇ ਧੂਸੇ
transliteration: Jam Dari Badhay Maareeani Jamadootaan Day Dhakay Dhoosay.
translation: Tied and beaten at the door of death, one receives the kicks of the messengers of death.

gurmukhi: ਗੋੲਿਲਿ ਵਾਸਾ ਚਾਰਿ ਦਿਨ ਨਾੳੁ ਧਰਾੲਿਨਿ ੲੀਸੇ ਮੂਸੇ
transliteration: Goili Vaasaa Chaari Din Naau Dharaaini Eesay Moosay.
translation: May be some one has named himself after Christ or Moses, but in this world all are to stay for a few days.

gurmukhi: ਘਟਿ ਨ ਕੋੲਿ ਅਖਾੲਿਦਾ ਅਾਪੋ ਧਾਪੀ ਹੈਰਤ ਹੂਸੇ
transliteration: Ghati N Koi Akhaaidaa Aapo Paapee Hairat Hoosay.
translation: Here none deems himself lesser one and all are engrossed in the rat race for selfish ends to find themselves shocked ultimately.

gurmukhi: ਸਾੲਿਰ ਦੇ ਮਰਜੀਵੜੇ ਕਰਨਿ ਮਜੂਰੀ ਖੇਚਲ ਖੂਸੇ
transliteration: Saair Day Marajeevarhay Karani Majooree Khaychal Khoosay.
translation: Those who are divers of the pleasure-ocean existing in the form of Guru, only they remain happy in the labour (of spiritual discipline).

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰੁ ਪੂਰੇ ਵਿਣੁ ਡਾਂਗ ਡੰਗੂਸੇ ॥੧੩॥
transliteration: Guroo Pooray Vinu Daang Dangoosay ?13?
translation: Without the true Guru, all are always at loggerheads.

gurmukhi: ੧੪ ਭੋਗਾਂ ਨਾਲ ਅੱਗ ਵਧੇ ਹੈ
translation: Enjoyments increase fire of lust

gurmukhi: ਚਿੰਤਾਮਣਿ ਗੁਰੁ ਛਡਿ ਕੈ ਚਿੰਤਾਮਣਿ ਚਿੰਤਾ ਨ ਗਵਾੲੇ
transliteration: Chintaamani Guru Chhadi Kai Chintaamani Chintaa N Gavaaay.
translation: The traditional wish fulfilling fabulous gem (chintamani) cannot remove anxiety if one could not cultivate the Guru, chintamani.

gurmukhi: ਚਿਤਵਣੀਅਾ ਲਖ ਰਾਤਿ ਦਿਹੁ ਤ੍ਰਾਸ ਨ ਤ੍ਰਿਸਨਾ ਅਗਨਿ ਬੁਝਾੲੇ
transliteration: Chitavaneeaa Lakh Raati Dihu Traas N Trisanaa Agani Bujhaaay.
translation: Many hopes and disappointments scare man day in and day out and the fire of desires it never quenched.

gurmukhi: ਸੁੲਿਨਾ ਰੁਪਾ ਅਗਲਾ ਮਾਣਕ ਮੋਤੀ ਅੰਗਿ ਹੰਢਾੲੇ
transliteration: Suinaa Roupaa Agalaa Maanak Motee Angi Handdhaaay.
translation: Plenty of gold, wealth, rubies and pearls are worn by man.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਟ ਪਟੰਬਰ ਪੈਨ੍ਹ ਕੇ ਚੋਅਾ ਚੰਦਨ ਮਹਿ ਮਹਕਾੲੇ
transliteration: Paat Patanbar Painh Kay Choaa Chandan Mahi Mahakaaay.
translation: Wearing silken garment scatters around the fragrance of sandal etc.

gurmukhi: ਹਾਥੀ ਘੋੜੇ ਪਾਖਰੇ ਮਹਲ ਬਗੀਚੇ ਸੁਫਲ ਫਲਾੲੇ
transliteration: Haadee Ghorhay Paakharay Mahal Bageechay Suphal Phalaaay.
translation: Man keeps elephants, horses, palaces, and fruit laden gardens.

gurmukhi: ਸੁੰਦਰ ਨਾਰੀ ਸੇਜ ਸੁਖ ਮਾੲਿਅਾ ਮੋਹਿ ਧੋਹਿ ਲਪਟਾੲੇ
transliteration: Soundari Naaree Sayj Soukhu Maaiaa Mohi Dhohi Lapataaay.
translation: Enjoying the pleasure-giving bed along with beautiful women, he remains engrossed in many deceptions and infatuations.

gurmukhi: ਬਲਦੀ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਤੇਲ ਜਿੳੁ ਅਾਸਾ ਮਨਸਾ ਦੁਖਿ ਵਿਹਾੲੇ
transliteration: Baladee Andari Taylu Jiu Aasaa Manasaa Doukhi Vihaaay.
translation: They all are fuels to the fire and man spends life in the sufferings of hopes and desires

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਪੂਰੇ ਵਿਣੁ ਜਮਪੁਰਿ ਜਾੲੇ ॥੧੪॥
transliteration: Gur Pooray Vinu Jam Puri Jaaay ?14?
translation: He has to reach the abode of Yama (death god) if he remains without the perfect Guru.

gurmukhi: ੧੫ ਕੁਦਰਤ ਦਾ ਵਰਣਨ
translation: Describing the creation

gurmukhi: ਲਖ ਤੀਰਥ ਲਖ ਦੇਵਤੇ ਪਾਰਸ ਲਖ ਰਸਾੲਿਣੁ ਜਾਣੈ
transliteration: Lakh Teerad Lakh Dayvatay Paaras Lakh Rasaainu Jaanai.
translation: Millions are pilgrimage centres and so are the gods, the philosopher's stones and chemicals.

gurmukhi: ਲਖ ਚਿੰਤਾਮਣਿ ਪਾਰਜਾਤ ਕਾਮਧੇਨੁ ਲਖ ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤ ਅਾਣੈ
transliteration: Lakh Chintaamani Paarajaat Kaamadhaynu Lakh Anmrit Aanai.
translation: Millions are chintamanis, wish fulfilling trees and cows, and nectars are also there numbering millions.

gurmukhi: ਰਤਨਾ ਸਣੁ ਸਾੲਿਰ ਘਣੇ ਰਿਧਿ ਸਿਧਿ ਨਿਧਿ ਸੋਭਾ ਸੁਲਤਾਣੈ
transliteration: Ratanaa Sanu Saair Ghanay Ridhi Sidhi Nidhi Sobhaa Sulataanai.
translation: Oceans with pearls, miraculous powers and the adorable kinds are also many.

gurmukhi: ਲਖ ਪਦਾਰਥ ਲਖ ਫਲ ਲਖ ਨਿਧਾਨ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਫੁਰਮਾਣੈ
transliteration: Lakh Padaarad Lakh Phal Lakh Nidhaanu Andari Phuramaanai.
translation: Materials, fruits and stores to be present to order are also millions in number.

gurmukhi: ਲਖ ਸਾਹ ਪਾਤਿਸਾਹ ਲਖ ਲਖ ਨਾਥ ਅਵਤਾਰੁ ਸੁਹਾਣੈ
transliteration: Lakh Saah Paatisaah Lakh Lakh Naad Avataaru Suhaanai.
translation: Bankers, emperors, naths and grand incarnations are also myriads in number.

gurmukhi: ਦਾਨੈ ਕੀਮਤਿ ਨਾ ਪਵੈ ਦਾਤੈ ਕੳੁਣੁ ਸੁਮਾਰੁ ਵਖਾਣੈ
transliteration: Daanai Keemati Naa Pavai Daatai Kaounu Soumaaru Vakhaanai.
translation: When charities bestowed cannot be evaluated, how can one describe the extent of the bestower.

gurmukhi: ਕੁਦਰਤਿ ਕਾਦਰ ਨੋ ਕੁਰਬਾਣੈ ॥੧੫॥
transliteration: Kudarati Kaadar No Kurabaanai ?15?
translation: This whole creation is sacrifice unto that creator Lord.

gurmukhi: ੧੬ ਗੁਰੂ ਚੇਲਾ, ਚੇਲਾ ਗੁਰੂ
translation: Guru-Disiple and disciple-Guru ,

gurmukhi: ਰਤਨਾ ਦੇਖੈ ਸਭੁ ਕੋ ਰਤਨ ਪਾਰਖੂ ਵਿਰਲਾ ਕੋੲੀ
transliteration: Ratanaa Daykhai Sabhu Ko Ratan Paarakhoo Viralaa Koee.
translation: The jewels are beholden by all but the jeweller is any rare one who test checks the jewels.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਗ ਨਾਦ ਸਭ ਕੋ ਸੁਣੈ ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਸਮਝੈ ਵਿਰਲੋੲੀ
transliteration: Raag Naad Sabh Ko Sounai Sabad Surati Samajhai Viraloee.
translation: All listen to the melody and rhythm but a rare one understands the mystery of Word consciousness,

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਰਤਨ ਪਦਾਰਥਾਂ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਮਿਲਿ ਮਾਲ ਪਰੋੲੀ
transliteration: Gurasikh Ratan Padaaradaa Saadhasangati Mili Maal Paroee.
translation: The Sikhs of the Guru are pearls who are strung in the garland in the form of congregation.

gurmukhi: ਹੀਰੈ ਹੀਰਾ ਬੇਧਿਅਾ ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਮਿਲਿ ਪਰਚਾ ਹੋੲੀ
transliteration: Heerai Heeraa Baydhiaa Sabad Surati Mili Parachaa Hoee.
translation: Only his consciousness remains merged in the Word whose mind diamond remains cut by the diamond of Word, the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਰਬ੍ਹਮ ਪੂਰਨ ਬ੍ਹਮੁ ਗੁਰੁ ਗੋਵਿੰਦੁ ਸਿਞਞਞਞਾਣੈ ਸੋੲੀ
transliteration: Paarabrahamu Pooran Brahamu Guru Govindu Siaanai Soee.
translation: The fact that the transcendental Brahm is the prefect Brahm and the Guru is God, is only identified by a gurmukh, the Guru-orientated one.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖਫਲੁ ਸਹਜਿ ਘਰੁ ਪਿਰਮ ਪਿਅਾਲਾ ਜਾਣੁ ਜਣੋੲੀ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukhaphalu Sahaji Gharu Piram Piaalaa Jaanu Janoee.
translation: Only gurmukhs enter the abode of inner knowledge to attain fruits of delight and only they know the delight of the cup of love and make others also know it.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰੁ ਚੇਲਾ ਚੇਲਾ ਗੁਰ ਹੋੲੀ ॥੧੬॥
transliteration: Guru Chaylaa Chaylaa Guru Hoee ?16?
translation: Then the Guru and the disciple become identical.

gurmukhi: ੧੭ ਅੰਗਾਂ ਦੀ ਸਫਲਤਾ
translation: Utility of the organs

gurmukhi: ਮਾਣਸ ਜਨਮੁ ਅਮੋਲੁ ਹੈ ਹੋੲਿ ਅਮੋਲੁ ਸਾਧਸੰਗ ਪਾੲੇ
transliteration: Maanas Janamu Amolu Hai Hoi Amolu Saadhasangu Paaay.
translation: Human life is invaluable and by being born man gets the company of the holy congregation.

gurmukhi: ਅਖੀ ਦੁੲਿ ਨਿਰਮੋਲਕਾ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਦਰਸ ਧਿਅਾਨ ਲਿਵਲਾੲੇ
transliteration: Akhee Dui Niramolakaa Satiguru Daras Dhiaan Liv Laaay.
translation: Both the eyes are invaluable who behold the true Guru and concentrating upon the Guru remain immersed in Him.

gurmukhi: ਮਸਤਕੁ ਸੀਸ ਅਮੋਲੁ ਹੈ ਚਰਣ ਸਰਣ ਗੁਰੁ ਧੂੜਿ ਸੁਹਾੲੇ
transliteration: Masataku Seesu Amolu Hai Charan Sarani Guru Dhoorhi Suhaaay.
translation: The forehead is also invaluable which remaining in the shelter of the feet of the Guru adorns itself with the dust of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਜਿਹਬਾ ਸ੍ਵਣ ਅਮੋਲਕਾ ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਸੁਣਿ ਸਮਝਿ ਸੁਣਾੲੇ
transliteration: Jihabaa Sravan Amolakaa Sabad Surati Souni Samajhi Sounaaay.
translation: Tongue and ears are also invaluable which carefully understanding and listening to the Word make other people also understand and listen.

gurmukhi: ਹਸਤ ਚਰਣ ਨਿਰਮੋਲਕਾ ਗੁਰਮੁਖ ਮਾਰਗਿ ਸੇਵ ਕਮਾੲੇ
transliteration: Hasat Charan Niramolakaa Guramoukh Maaragi Sayv Kamaaay.
translation: Hands and feet are also invaluable which move on the way of becoming gurmukh and perform service.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਰਿਦਾ ਅਮੋਲੁ ਹੈ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਗੁਰੁ ੳੁਪਦੇਸੁ ਵਸਾੲੇ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Ridaa Amolu Hai Andari Guru Oupadaysu Vasaaay.
translation: Invaluable is the heart of gurmukh wherein resides the teaching of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਪਤਿ ਪਰਵਾਣੈ ਤੋਲਿ ਤੁਲਾੲੇ ॥੧੭॥
transliteration: Pati Paravaanai Toli Tulaaay ?17?
translation: Whosoever becomes equal to such gurmukhs, is respected in the court of the Lord.

gurmukhi: ੧੮ ਰੱਬ ਦੀਅਾਂ ਦਾਤਾਂ ਤੇ ਸਾਡੀ ਭੁੱਲ
translation: Gifts of the Lord and our mistakes

gurmukhi: ਰਕਤੁ ਬਿੰਦ ਕਰਿ ਨਿਮਿਅਾ ਚਿਤ੍ਰ ਚਲਿਤ੍ਰ ਬਚਿਤ੍ਰ ਬਣਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Rakatu Bindu Kari Nimiaa Chitr Chalitr Bachitr Banaaiaa.
translation: From the blood of mother and semen of father the human body was created and the Lord accomplished this wonderful feat.

gurmukhi: ਗਰਭ ਕੁੰਡ ਵਿਚਿ ਰਖਿਅਾ ਜੀੳੁਪਾੲਿ ਤਨੁ ਸਾਜਿ ਸੁਹਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Garabh Kound Vichi Rakhiaa Jeeu Paai Tanu Saaji Suhaaiaa.
translation: This human body was kept in the well of the womb. Then life was infused in it and its grandeur was further enhanced.

gurmukhi: ਮੁਹੁ ਅਖੀ ਦੇ ਨਕੁ ਕੰਨ ਹਥ ਪੈਰ ਦੰਦ ਵਾਲ ਗਣਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Muhu Akhee Day Naku Kann Had Pair Dand Vaal Ganaaiaa.
translation: Mouth, eyes, nose, ears, hands, teeth, hair etc. were bestowed upon it.

gurmukhi: ਦਿਸਟਿ ਸਬਦ ਗਤਿ ਸੁਰਤ ਲਿਵ ਰਾਗ ਰੰਗ ਰਸ ਪਰਸ ਲੁਭਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Disati Sabad Gati Surati Livai Raag Rang Ras Par Salu Bhaaiaa.
translation: Man was given sight, speech, power of listening and consciousness of merging in the Word. For his ears, eyes, tongue and skin, the form, joy, smell etc. were created.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਤਮੁ ਕੁਲੁ ੳੁਤਮੁ ਜਨਮੁ ਰੋਮ ਰੋਮ ਗਣਿ ਅੰਗ ਬਣਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Outamu Kulu Outamu Janamu Rom Rom Gani Ang Sabaaiaa.
translation: By giving the best family (of human being) and birth in it, the Lord god gave shape to one and all organs.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਲਬੁਧਿ ਮੁਹਿ ਦੁਧਿ ਦੇ ਕਰਿ ਮਲ ਮੂਤ੍ਰ ਸੂਤ੍ਰ ਵਿਚਿ ਅਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Baalabudhi Muhi Dudhi Day Kari Mal Mootr Sootr Vichi Aaiaa.
translation: During infancy, mother pours milk into the mouth and make (the baby) defecate.

gurmukhi: ਹੋੲਿ ਸਿਅਾਣਾ ਸਮਝਿਅਾ ਕਰਤਾ ਛਡਿ ਕੀਤੇ ਲਪਟਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Hoi Siaanaa Samajhiaa Karataa Chhadi Keetay Lapataaiaa.
translation: When grown up, he (man) leaving aside the creator Lord becomes engrossed with His creation.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਪੂਰੇ ਵਿਣੁ ਮੋਹਿਅਾ ਮਾੲਿਅਾ ॥੨੮॥
transliteration: Gur Pooray Vinu Mohiaa Maaiaa ?18?
translation: Without the perfect Guru, man goes on to be engrossed into the web of maya.

gurmukhi: ੧੯ ਗੁਰੂ ਬਾਝ ਗਰਭ ਵਾਸ
translation: Without Guru, the goings and comings continue

gurmukhi: ਮਨਮੁਖ ਮਾਣਸ ਦੇਹ ਤੇ ਪਸੂ ਪਰੇਤ ਅਚੇਤ ਚੰਗੇਰੇ
transliteration: Manamoukh Maanas Dayh Tay Pasoo Parayt Achayt Changayray.
translation: Animals and ghosts said to be without wisdom are better than manmukh the mind-orientated.

gurmukhi: ਹੋੲਿ ਸੁਚੇਤ ਅਚੇਤ ਹੋੲਿ ਮਾਣਸੁ ਮਾਣਸੁ ਦੇ ਵਲਿ ਹੇਰੇ
transliteration: Hoi Souchayt Achayt Hoi Maanasu Maanas Day Vali Hayray.
translation: Even being wise the man becomes fool and goes on looking towards men (to meet his selfish ends).

gurmukhi: ਪਸੂ ਨ ਮੰਗੈ ਪਸੂ ਤੇ ਪੰਖੇਰੂ ਪੰਖੇਰੂ ਘੇਰੇ
transliteration: Pasoo N Mangai Pasoo Tay Pankhayroo Pankhayroo Ghayray.
translation: An animal from animals and a bird from birds never ask for anything.

gurmukhi: ਚੳੁਰਾਸੀ ਲਖ ਜੂਨਿ ਵਿਚਿ ੳੁਤਮ ਮਾਣਸ ਜੂਨਿ ਭਲੇਰੇ
transliteration: Chauraaseeh Lakh Jooni Vichi Outam Maanas Jooni Bhalayray.
translation: Among eighty-four lakh species of life, the human life is the best one.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਤਮ ਮਨ ਬਚ ਕਰਮ ਕਰਿ ਜਨਮੁ ਮਰਣ ਭਵਜਲ ਲਖ ਫੇਰੇ
transliteration: Outam Man Bach Karam Kari Janamu Maran Bhavajalu Lakh Dhayray.
translation: Having even the best mind, speech and actions, man goes on transmigtraing in the ocean of life and death.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਜਾ ਪਰਜਾ ਹੋੲਿ ਕੈ ਸੁਖ ਵਿਚਿ ਦੁਖੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਭਲੇ ਭਲੇਰੇ
transliteration: Raajaa Parajaa Hoi Kai Soukh Vichi Doukhu Hoi Bhalay Bhalayray.
translation: Whether it is a king or the people, even the good persons suffer the fear (of going away) from pleasure.

gurmukhi: ਕੁਤਾ ਰਾਜ ਬਹਾਲੀਅੈ ਚਕੀ ਚਟਣ ਜਾੲਿ ਅਨ੍ਹੇਰੇ
transliteration: Koutaa Raaj Bahaaleeai Chakee Chatan Jaai Anhayray.
translation: Dog, even if enthroned, according to its basic nature goes on to lick the flourmill at the fall of darkness.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਪੂਰੇ ਵਿਣੁ ਗਰਭ ਵਸੇਰੇ ॥੧੯॥
transliteration: Gur Pooray Vinu Garabh Vasayray ?19?
translation: Without the perfect Guru one has to stay in the abode of womb i.e. the transmigration never ends.

gurmukhi: ੨੦ ਗੁਰਮੁਖ ਬਾਝ ਰਸ ਨਹੀਂ
translation: No joy without Gurmukh

gurmukhi: ਵਣਿ ਵਣਿ ਵਾਸੁ ਵਣਾਸਪਤਿ ਚੰਦਨੁ ਬਾਝੁ ਨ ਚੰਦਨ ਹੋੲੀ
transliteration: Vani Vani Vaasu Vanaasapati Chandanu Baajhu N Chandanu Hoee.
translation: The forests are replete with vegetation but without sandalwood, the fragrance of sandal does not occur in it.

gurmukhi: ਪਰਬਤਿ ਪਰਬਤਿ ਅਸਟਧਾਤੁ ਪਾਰਸ ਬਾਝੁ ਨ ਕੰਚਨੁ ਸੋੲੀ
transliteration: Parabati Parabati Asat Dhaatu Paaras Baajhu N Kanchanu Soee.
translation: Minerals are there on all the mountain but without the philosopher's stone they do not transform into gold.

gurmukhi: ਚਾਰਿ ਵਰਣਿ ਛਿਅ ਦਰਸਨਾ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਵਿਣੁ ਸਾਧ ਨ ਕੋੲੀ
transliteration: Chaari Varani Chhia Darasanaa Saadhasangati Vinu Saadhu N Koee.
translation: None among the four varnas and the scholars of the six philosophies can become (true) sadhu without the company of saints.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ੳੁਪਦੇਸੁ ਅਵੇਸ ਕਰਿ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਜਾਣੋੲੀ
transliteration: Gur Oupadaysu Avaysu Kari Guramoukhi Saadhasangati Jaanoee.
translation: Charged by the teachings of the Guru, gurmukhs understand the importance of the company of the saints.

gurmukhi: ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਲਿਵ ਲੀਣੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਪਿਰਮ ਪਿਅਾਲਾ ਅਪਿੳੁ ਪਿਓੲੀ
transliteration: Sabad Surati Liv Leenu Hoi Piram Piaalaa Apiu Piaoee.
translation: Then, they getting the consciousness attuned to the Word, quaff the cup of nectar of loving devotion.

gurmukhi: ਮਨਿ ੳੁਨਮਨਿ ਤਨਿ ਦੁਬਲੇ ਦੇਹ ਬਿਦੇਹ ਸਨੇਹ ਸਥੋੲੀ
transliteration: Mani Ounamani Tani Doubalay Dayh Bidayh Sanayh Sadoee.
translation: The mind now reaching the highest stage of spiritual realisation (turiya) and becoming subtle stabilises in the love of the Lord.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲ ਅਲਖ ਲਖੋੲੀ ॥੨੦॥
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Alakh Lakhoee ?20?
translation: Gurmukhs beholding the invisible Lord receive the fruits of that pleasure.

gurmukhi: ੨੧ ਮਾੲਿਅਾ ਵਿਚ ੳੁਦਾਸ
translation: Indifferent to maya

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲੁ ਸਾਧਸੰਗੁ ਮਾੲਿਅਾ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਕਰਨਿ ੳੁਦਾਸੀ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Saadhasangu Maaiaa Andari Karani Udaasee.
translation: Gumukhs get pleasure in the company of saints. They remain indifferent to maya though they live in it.

gurmukhi: ਜਿੳੁ ਜਲ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਕਵਲੁ ਹੈ ਸੂਰਜ ਧ੍ਰਯਾਨੁ ਅਗਾਸੁ ਨਿਵਾਸੀ
transliteration: Jiu Jal Andari Kavalu Hai Sooraj Dhaanu Agaasu Nivaasee.
translation: As a lotus, which remains in water and yet keep its gaze fixed towards the sun, gurmukhs always keep their consciousness attuned to the Lord.

gurmukhi: ਚੰਦਨੁ ਸਪੀਂ ਵੇੜਿਅਾ ਸੀਤਲੁ ਸਾਂਤਿ ਸੁਗੰਧਿ ਵਿਗਾਸੀ
transliteration: Chandanu Sapeen Vayrhiaa Seetalu Saanti Sougandhi Vigaasee.
translation: The sandalwood remains entwined by snakes but still it spreads cool and peace-producing fragrance all around.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਸੰਸਾਰ ਵਿਚਿ ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਲਿਵ ਸਹਜਿ ਬਿਲਾਸੀ
transliteration: Saadhasangati Sansaar Vichi Sabad Surati Liv Sahaji Bilaasee.
translation: Gurmukhs living in the world, through the company of the saints keeping the consciousness attuned to the Word, move around in equipoise.

gurmukhi: ਜੋਗ ਜੁਗਤਿ ਭੋਗ ਭੁਗਤਿ ਜਿਣ ਜੀਵਨ ਮੁਕਤਿ ਅਛਲ ਅਬਿਨਾਸੀ
transliteration: Jog Jougati Bhog Bhougati Jini Jeevan Moukati Achhal Abinaasee.
translation: They conquering the technique of yoga and bhog (enjoyment) become liberated in life, undecievable and indestructible.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਰਬ੍ਹਮ ਪੂਰਣ ਬ੍ਹਮੁ ਗੁਰ ਪਰਮੇਸਰੁ ਅਾਸ ਨਿਰਾਸੀ
transliteration: Paarabraham Pooran Brahamu Gur Paramaysaru Aas Niraasee.
translation: As the transcendetal Brahm is the perfect Brahm , the same way the Guru who is indifferent to hopes and desires is also nothing but God.

gurmukhi: ਅਕਥ ਕਥਾ ਅਬਿਗਤਿ ਪਰਗਾਸੀ ॥੨੧॥੧੫॥
transliteration: Akad Kadaa Abigati Paragaasee ?21?15?pandraan?
translation: (Through the Guru) that ineffable story and unmenifest light of the Lord becomes known (to the world).

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖਫਲ ਸ੍ਵਾਦ ਬਿਸਮਾਦ ਅਤਿ ਅਕਥ ਕਥਾ ਬਿਨੋਦ ਕਹਤ ਨ ਅਾਵੲੀ
transliteration: Gurmukhi Soukhaphal Svaad Bisamaad Ati , Akad Kadaa Binod Kahat N Aavaee ?
translation: The spiritual happiness of a devout Sikh of Guru who meditates on Lord's name, the bliss and his spiritual happiness is wonderful beyond explanation.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮਖਿ ਸੁਖਫਲ ਗੰਧ ਪਰਮਦਭੁਤ ਸੀਤਲ ਕੋਮਲ ਪਰਸਤ ਬਨਿ ਅਾਵੲੀ
transliteration: Gurmakhi Soukhaphal Gandh Paramadabhouta , Seetal Komal Parasat Bani Aavaee ?
translation: The peace and joy of a Guru-conscious person diffuses wonderful fragrance. Its tranquility and softness can only be realised when it is relished. There is no limit of the divine peace and wisdom of such a Guru-oriented person. It can understood best when

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖਫਲ ਮਹਿਮਾ ਅਗਾਧਿ ਬੋਧ ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖ ਸੰਧ ਮਿਲਿ ਅਲਖ ਲਖਾਵੲੀ
transliteration: Gurmukhi Soukhaphal Mahimaa Agaadhi Bodha , Gur Sikh Sandh Mili Alakh Lakhaavaee ?
translation: One who is a devout Sikh of Guru, the glory of his spiritual, knowledge gets reflected in every limb of his body umpteen times. Every hair of his body becomes alive with divine effulgence.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖਫਲ ਅੰਗਿ ਅੰਗਿ ਕੋਟ ਸੋਭਾ ਮਾੲਿਅਾ ਕੈ ਦਿਖਾਵੈ ਸੋ ਤੋ ਅਨਤ ਨ ਧਾਵੲੀ ॥੧੫॥
transliteration: Gurmukhi Soukhaphal Angi Angi Kot Sobhaa , Maaiaa Kai Dikhaavai So To Anat N Dhaavaee ?15?
translation: By his grace, whosoever is shown this state of spiritual bliss, does not wander about anywhere. (15)
